timeline.message:
Merge pull request #1 from typetools/master

Update fork
Add version option and extract release properties
Add version and extract relese properties

timeline.bodyText: Please use correct capitalization for Checker Framework.
timeline.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: Use correct name for Checker Framework.
timeline.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: You need to document that this can return null.  Under what circumstances can it do so?  Should it throw an exception rather than returning null?
timeline.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: Why does this loop continue after setting version?  Could you use a return statement here?
timeline.author: mernst
mernst

timeline.bodyText: Is it a bug if this line is reached?  If so, it is better to fail than to print a line that users are likely to overlook.
timeline.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: Under what circumstances is version null?  Is that a bug?
timeline.author: mernst

replies.bodyText: Its never null for the current version. It can only be null if the tag in release.properties is not found in XML_FILE. Should I remove this check altogether and throw an exception if ever version is null?
replies.author: PRITI1999

replies.bodyText: Since that would indicate an unexpected problem, I think that is the best approach.
replies.author: mernst

replies.bodyText: Made the changes accordingly. Please re-review.
replies.author: PRITI1999

replies.bodyText: @PRITI1999 CI does not pass.  Please make it pass before requesting a review.
replies.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: Minor: end sentences with punctuation (in this case, a period).
timeline.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: It is usually not necessary to state the type, which is already stated nearby in the source code and in the generated API documentation.
timeline.author: mernst
mernst

timeline.bodyText: If you use "Extract", say from where.  Even better, I would leave implementation details like that out of the specification and just use "Returns".
timeline.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: This is an odd choice of exception.  Why not use BugInCF?
timeline.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: This line can be combined with the following one.
timeline.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: This user-visible change needs to be documented in the manual and in the changelog.
timeline.author: mernst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -253,6 +253,8 @@
 
     /// Amount of detail in messages
 
+    // Print the version of the Checker Framework
+    "version",

timeline.bodyText: Does this work?  It crashed for me when I tried to run it, because neither of the two files is not available in checker.jar.
timeline.author: mernst

replies.bodyText: You could use git.properties instead.  See method printGitProperties.
replies.author: mernst

timeline.message: No need to document BugInCF condition
